page.title: 17Interesting Notes
page.content: Relics of the past still exist in the town. Some can't be taken away and remain as a reminder of the times. 1. Ice House Bedwellty House. This was discovered by a team of boys working for Community Industry in Bedwellty Park. They were using the Bell House as a cabin and discovered the Ice House immediately beneath it in excellent condition. It emphasised the fact that at one time Bedwellty House lived and entertained well. 2. Dukes Table. To be found to the north of Trefil. It is a man made mound surrouded by a bench seat at the side of a spring used by the Duke of Beaufort and partly to eat lunch when they were hunting the moors.
